Posts.Content: Hi howdy  I've nothing positive to add but just to let you know I feel exactly the same. Feel like I'm going a bit mad in the head. However  I let it out  and then normality seems to come back to me. It's good to let it out  then try and get on with things. I try to tell myself worrying will change nothing and only waste precious time which sometimes brings me back again. I was diagnosed end of April and still waiting on node biopsy before they can set out my treatment path, waiting is the worst x x
Posts.Title: What ifs........

Posts.Content: Hi nonrag what are anti sickness bands and where do you get them?  Just had second cycle this afternoon and I got an anti sickness injection as well as anti sickness and steroid tabs. It's made me very sleepy zzzz
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Must look out for them, I was sick first night first cycle then slightly queasy for 2 days  then was grand  but ate alot. Hoping this one will be the same. Was so surprised when they said I'd only put on 2lb after all my munching lol x x
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Acetone free  nail polish remover Cuticle remover Head coverings, just in case, it goes pretty quick once it starts going! Paracetamol anti bacterial hand gel  And a good sense of humour lol x x
Posts.Title: Shopping list for chemo - am I missing anything?

Posts.Content: Hi Mel  hope you're feeling a bit better now. Mine started coming out day 14 after first cycle so my sister in law but it short they shaved it at a number 2 four days later  there was quite alot left but was beginning to get patchy. The small hair are actually worse than long ones  as the clung to my sleep hats I ordered for Anna bandana so I went to a nought few days later. I wear my wig constantly unless sleeping and it's easy to forget it's there. My girls still fiddle with my hair (wig)  lol  due my 3rd cycle next Thursday and have stubble on head  now wondering does it all go or might the stubble continue to grow.  If you shave it  you'll be grand in day or two honestly x x
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Good woman Mel  your update even sounded upbeat  you may have a tear or two once you shave it  but it will be one less thing to worry about :-) x x
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Hi  i was going to post something similar today. I was meant to go to a show on Tuesday which is day 13 of my cycle  but I'm guessing now advice would be not to go?  I did go to asda shopping  and mass today and washed hands once home. Wasn't given any of the advice someone listed above, have generally been carrying on as normal with head down. Have been feeling fine which makes it all a bit more dangerous as I don't think about it as much as I should.
Posts.Title: risk of infection- chemo

Posts.Content: Good luck with your first session. I've had 2 so far and brought a different person each time  and sat nattering and laughing. My experiences and others in the room are quite chatty and upbeat, atmosphere  of sitting getting your nails done and chatting to the nurse, not overly clinical and bit weird when you get up to walk home  and think  was that it!  Hopefully you won't have any sickness but if you do be assured that they will try different medicines the next time to try and combat it x x
Posts.Title: treatment starts Tuesday

Posts.Content: Think I'm starting to fear risk of infection whilst on chemo more than the chemo itself. Small Things seem to be creeping in, sore head, sore throat, slight bleeding and now throbbing sore tooth/gum. Does     anyone else ring their helpline with every ailment?   got  bloods taken on Friday and doctors receptionist rang today to ask if I had any signs of infection but gave me no  further information on their query! Can a throbbing gum lead to infection? Tooth is already dead as had root canal etc over 20  years ago so know it's not tooth
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: Hi Gillie  does  sore gums include throbbing in one area? If thought it was a  side effect I wouldn't worry so much. Wasn't throbbing this morning when she rang., sods law!
Posts.Title: infection risk

Posts.Content: Hi Jean  I had  that choice today!  my mastectomy two weeks ago showed grade 2 medium size tumour  and was advised possible recurrence risks - without further treatment 18 %, with tax 11% or with chemo 6%. I want the best chance so going for chemo and will  prayso hard for it to work. I start 17 July after I come home from a holiday in the sun  then roll on Christmas!! Best of  luck with your decision x x
Posts.Title: Jean

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline  sorry to hear about your situation  if it helps at all  I chose a mastectomy over a lumpectomy and have a tissue expander inserted until after chemo, the mastectomy has been  no  bother at all. Was in hospital for 3 nights and got drains out before went home. I did the exercises given and didn't drive for 4 weeks, but went to Portugal after week 3 :-). But I had no pain or complaints. It was uncomfortable at times but I didn't need pain killers once home from hospital. You have been through so much all ready and I know each case is different and I had a brilliant surgeon but if you need to go down that route it is totally manageable and not the worst thing in the world to look at lol Love daisy x x
Posts.Title: 2 WLE and waiting for results.

Posts.Content: Hi nonrag  I had first Fec just under two weeks ago  and got 5 pills just before my chemo and 2 days supply  to take home. I was very sick the first night, slightly queasy following two days  and have been grand since. Ate ridiculous amount of food the first week lol but back to normal now. Would rather put some weight on now incase I have other side affects with other cycles and can't eat. I thought the steroids were part of the anti sickness regime but maybe not.
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: Excellent post Katie  love the humour lol  one tip I have is  if your hair is long put it in a bobble at night  that way your finding your hair in your brush and not on your pillow. Another one is  when you get round to shaving hair, I got fed up with it coming out after 3 days, watch something like sister act with your best buddy and sing and have a laugh and experiment with shorter styles for the evening. Really takes the pain out of going from long to a sinead oConnor do. I actually sat with  earphones in singing my heart out(badly) while she shaved  it also made the terrible task easier for her. Wig has been worn since yesterday morning and I'm well chuffed with it :-). another must do  if your only affected on one breast be sure and totally  familiarise yourself with your other one  before you start chemo, wish I had done it now  as don't know what it was like before and am constantly checking for lumps.   If I think of anything else I'll post. Good luck :-) x x
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!
